required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Immunogenicity of GSK Biologicals' Investigational Malaria Vaccine in HIV Infected Infants and Children
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Immunogenicity Study of GSK Biologicals' Plasmodium Falciparum Malaria Vaccine 257049 Administered to HIV Infected Infants and Children

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and immunogenicity of the candidate malaria vaccine in HIV-infected infants and children

detailed_description.textblock: This protocol posting has been updated due to protocol Amendment 2.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from 30 days before Dose 1 up to Month 14)
primary_outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses: Day 1 through Day 7, Month 1 through Month 1 + 7 days (Day 37), Month 2 through Month 2 + 7 days (Day 67)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond (>) 20 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 7-day post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses: Day 1 through Day 7, Month 1 through Month 1 + 7 days (Day 37), Month 2 through Month 2 + 7 days (Day 67)
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever [defined as axillary temperature equal to or above (≥) 37.5 degrees Celsius (°C)]. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 drowsiness = drowsiness that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 irritability/fussiness = crying that could not be comforted/prevented normal activity. Grade 3 loss of appetite = not eating at all. Grade 3 fever = fever > 39.0 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as causally related to the study vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 30-day post-vaccination period (up to Day 90)
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Non-malaria Related SAEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from 30 days before vaccine Dose 1 up to Month 14)
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs (excluding malaria, cerebral malaria and P. falciparum parasitemia) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-circumsporozoite Protein of P. Falciparum (Anti-CS) Antibody Concentrations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to vaccination (PRE) and one month post Dose 3 (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-CS antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL). The reference seropositivity cut-off value was equal to or above (≥) 0.5 EL.U/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Anti-hepatitis B Surface Antigen (Anti-HBs) Antibody Titers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prior to vaccination (PRE) and one month post Dose 3 (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-HBs antibody titers are presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs), expressed in milliinternational units per milliliter (mIU/mL).

Anti-CS antibody concentrations are presented as geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), expressed in ELISA units per milliliter (EL.U/mL). The reference seropositivity cut-off value was equal to or above (≥) 0.5 EL.U/mL.
Anti-HBs antibody titers are presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs), expressed in mIU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Episodes With Clinical Malaria Disease According to Primary Case Definition
secondary_outcome.description: Primary case definition for clinical malaria: P. falciparum asexual parasitemia > 2500 parasites/μL and presence of fever (axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C) at the time of presentation and occurring in a child who was unwell and brought for treatment to a healthcare facility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Episodes With Severe Malaria According to Primary Case Definition
secondary_outcome.description: The number of episodes of severe malaria of primary case definition within and outside risk period. Primary case definition for severe malaria: P. falciparum > 2500 parasites per μL and with one or more marker of disease severity and without a diagnosis of co-morbidity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Affected by Prevalent Parasitemia and Prevalent Moderate Anemia
secondary_outcome.description: The number of subjects affected by prevalent asexual P. falciparum parasitemia and prevalent moderate anemia. Moderate anemia = hemoglobin < 8 g/dL.
The number of subjects with a positive blood slide for asexual P. falciparum.
The prevalent hemoglobin level in subjects with a positive blood slide is reported as grams per deciliter (g/dl).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE) and at one month (Month 3), 6 months (Month 8) and 12 months (Month 14) post Dose 3
secondary_outcome.description: The HIV viral load is reported. Detectable HIV viral load: 400 or more copies/mL.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE) and at one month (Month 3), 6 months (Month 8) and 12 months (Month 14) post Dose 3
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of CD4+ cells is reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE) and at 1 month (Month 3), 6 months (Month 8) and 12 months (Month 14) post Dose 3
secondary_outcome.description: The CD4+ absolute cell counts are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: World Health Organization (WHO) HIV Clinical Classification Progression
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE), at study months 1 (Month 1) and 2 (Month 2) and at 1 month (Month 3), 6 months (Month 8) and 12 months (Month 14) post Dose 3
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical staging was done at each time point according to the WHO HIV/AIDS clinical staging system. Clinical stages included: "Stage 1" (asymptomatic or have persistent generalized lymphadenopathy), "Stage 2" (mildly symptomatic stage - presenting with unexplained weight loss of less than 10 percent of total body weight, recurrent respiratory infections or dermatological conditions), "Stage 3" (moderately symptomatic stage - presenting with weight loss of greater than 10 percent of total body weight, prolonged unexplained diarrhea or pulmonary tuberculosis, severe systemic bacterial infections or mucocutaneous conditions), "Stage 4" (severely symptomatic stage which includes all of the AIDS-defining illnesses) Additional categories included "deceased" and "missing".

secondary_outcome.measure: Growth Parameters: Weight, Age/Length and Middle Upper Arm Circumference for Age Z-score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE), at Month 3 and at study end (Month 14)
secondary_outcome.description: The following growth parameters: weight, age/length and middle upper arm circumference for age z-score are reported.

arm_group.description: Infants enrolled to this group will receive 3 doses of the experimental vaccine.
Infants enrolled to this group will receive 3 doses of the rabies comparator vaccine.

intervention.description: All infants enrolled to group A will receive 3 doses of the experimental vaccine. The vaccine will be administered intramuscularly.

intervention.intervention_name: Human Diploid Cell Vaccine (HDCV) or Purified Vero Cell Rabies Vaccine (PVRV, Verorab) (Aventis Pasteur);
intervention.description: To ensure consistent vaccine availability, three cell culture rabies vaccines from two manufacturers may be sourced for this trial (Aventis-Pasteur and Novartis). It will be ensured that an individual child will receive all 3 doses of cell culture rabies vaccine from the same product. The vaccine will be administered intramuscularly

intervention.intervention_name: Purified Chick Embryo Cell Culture (PCEC) Rabies Vaccine (Rabipur or equivalent) (Novartis).
intervention.description: To ensure consistent vaccine availability, three cell culture rabies vaccines from two manufacturers may be sourced for this trial (Aventis-Pasteur and Novartis). It will be ensured that an individual child will receive all 3 doses of cell culture rabies vaccine from the same product. The vaccine will be administered intramuscularly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All subjects must satisfy ALL the following criteria at study entry:
- A male or female infant or child between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, at the time of first vaccination.
- Signed or thumb-printed informed consent obtained from the parent(s)/LAR(s) of the infant or child. Where parents/LARs are illiterate, the consent form will be countersigned by a witness.
- Subjects who the investigator believes that their parents/LARs can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol should be enrolled in the study.
- Subjects who are known to be HIV-infected (documented positive DNA PCR), whether taking HIV antiretroviral treatment (ART) or not.
- Subjects who are born following a normal gestation period.
Exclusion Criteria:
The following criteria should be checked at the time of study entry. If ANY exclusion criterion applies, the subject must not be included in the study:
- Acute disease at the time of enrolment. However, the presence of an illness listed as Grade I or Grade II (WHO pediatric AIDS clinical staging) will not of itself constitute an exclusion criterion. Enrolment should be deferred if axillary temperature is >=37.5°C.
- Grade III or Grade IV abnormality on screening laboratory blood sample.
- Grade III or IV AIDS at the time of enrolment (WHO pediatric AIDS clinical staging).
- Major congenital defects.
- Planned administration/administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol prior to or within 7 days of study vaccine.
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) other than the study vaccine 30 days preceding Dose°1 of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period.
- Previous participation in any other malaria vaccine trial.
- Simultaneous participation in another clinical trial including administration of experimental treatment.
- Same sex twins.
- History of allergic reactions (significant IgE-mediated events) or anaphylaxis to previous immunizations.
- History of allergic disease or reactions likely to be exacerbated by any component of the study vaccine.
- Child in care.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

group.title: GSK257049 Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of GSK257049 vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

group.title: Verorab Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of Verorab™ vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Failure to comply with study procedures

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: SAEs assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life-threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period (from 30 days before Dose 1 up to Month 14)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort which included all vaccinated subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. outcome.title: Number of Episodes With Clinical Malaria Disease According to Primary Case Definition
outcome.description: Primary case definition for clinical malaria: P. falciparum asexual parasitemia > 2500 parasites/μL and presence of fever (axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C) at the time of presentation and occurring in a child who was unwell and brought for treatment to a healthcare facility.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects included in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

group.title: GSK257049 Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of GSK257049 vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

group.title: Verorab Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of Verorab™ vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

measure.title: Number of Episodes With Clinical Malaria Disease According to Primary Case Definition
measure.description: Primary case definition for clinical malaria: P. falciparum asexual parasitemia > 2500 parasites/μL and presence of fever (axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C) at the time of presentation and occurring in a child who was unwell and brought for treatment to a healthcare facility.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects included in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

outcome.title: Number of Episodes With Severe Malaria According to Primary Case Definition
outcome.description: The number of episodes of severe malaria of primary case definition within and outside risk period. Primary case definition for severe malaria: P. falciparum > 2500 parasites per μL and with one or more marker of disease severity and without a diagnosis of co-morbidity.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects included in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

group.title: GSK257049 Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of GSK257049 vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

group.title: Verorab Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of Verorab™ vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

measure.title: Number of Episodes With Severe Malaria According to Primary Case Definition
measure.description: The number of episodes of severe malaria of primary case definition within and outside risk period. Primary case definition for severe malaria: P. falciparum > 2500 parasites per μL and with one or more marker of disease severity and without a diagnosis of co-morbidity.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects included in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Affected by Prevalent Parasitemia and Prevalent Moderate Anemia
outcome.description: The number of subjects affected by prevalent asexual P. falciparum parasitemia and prevalent moderate anemia. Moderate anemia = hemoglobin < 8 g/dL.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

measure.description: The number of subjects affected by prevalent asexual P. falciparum parasitemia and prevalent moderate anemia. Moderate anemia = hemoglobin < 8 g/dL.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

outcome.title: Asexual P. Falciparum Parasitemia Density
outcome.description: The number of subjects with a positive blood slide for asexual P. falciparum.
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on children affected by prevalent parasitemia from the ATP population for efficacy, which included subjects in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

group.title: GSK257049 Group

outcome.title: Prevalent Hemoglobin Level
outcome.description: The prevalent hemoglobin level in subjects with a positive blood slide is reported as grams per deciliter (g/dl).
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP population for efficacy, which included all subjects in the Total Vaccinated cohort who received all vaccinations according to protocol procedures within specified intervals that contribute time at risk in the follow-up period starting 14 days post Dose 3.

outcome.title: HIV Viral Load
outcome.description: The HIV viral load is reported. Detectable HIV viral load: 400 or more copies/mL.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE) and at one month (Month 3), 6 months (Month 8) and 12 months (Month 14) post Dose 3
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: World Health Organization (WHO) HIV Clinical Classification Progression
outcome.description: Clinical staging was done at each time point according to the WHO HIV/AIDS clinical staging system. Clinical stages included: "Stage 1" (asymptomatic or have persistent generalized lymphadenopathy), "Stage 2" (mildly symptomatic stage - presenting with unexplained weight loss of less than 10 percent of total body weight, recurrent respiratory infections or dermatological conditions), "Stage 3" (moderately symptomatic stage - presenting with weight loss of greater than 10 percent of total body weight, prolonged unexplained diarrhea or pulmonary tuberculosis, severe systemic bacterial infections or mucocutaneous conditions), "Stage 4" (severely symptomatic stage which includes all of the AIDS-defining illnesses) Additional categories included "deceased" and "missing".
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE), at study months 1 (Month 1) and 2 (Month 2) and at 1 month (Month 3), 6 months (Month 8) and 12 months (Month 14) post Dose 3
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

group.title: GSK257049 Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of GSK257049 vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

group.title: Verorab Group
group.description: Male and female infants and children between and including 6 weeks to 17 months of age, known to be HIV-infected, who received a 3-dose course of Verorab™ vaccine administered via intramuscular injection, for infants aged less than (<) 5 months, in the left anterolateral thigh and, for infants/children aged 5 months or more (≥ 5 months), in the left deltoid, at Days 0, 30 and 60.

measure.title: World Health Organization (WHO) HIV Clinical Classification Progression
measure.description: Clinical staging was done at each time point according to the WHO HIV/AIDS clinical staging system. Clinical stages included: "Stage 1" (asymptomatic or have persistent generalized lymphadenopathy), "Stage 2" (mildly symptomatic stage - presenting with unexplained weight loss of less than 10 percent of total body weight, recurrent respiratory infections or dermatological conditions), "Stage 3" (moderately symptomatic stage - presenting with weight loss of greater than 10 percent of total body weight, prolonged unexplained diarrhea or pulmonary tuberculosis, severe systemic bacterial infections or mucocutaneous conditions), "Stage 4" (severely symptomatic stage which includes all of the AIDS-defining illnesses) Additional categories included "deceased" and "missing".
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Growth Parameters: Weight, Age/Length and Middle Upper Arm Circumference for Age Z-score
outcome.description: The following growth parameters: weight, age/length and middle upper arm circumference for age z-score are reported.
outcome.time_frame: At baseline (PRE), at Month 3 and at study end (Month 14)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all vaccinated subjects with at least one vaccine administration documented.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local and general symptoms: during the 7-day (Days 0-6) post-vaccination period; Unsolicited AEs: during the 30-day (Days 0-29) post vaccination period; SAEs: during the entire study period (from Day 0 up to Month 14).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
